note.p: Birth: Brock Street, Lancaster, England (24 May 1794)
Career: First person to give the term 'scientist' its modern meaning; Died from a mortal injury caused from falling from his bolting horse, Trinity College, Cambridge
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1867-1868 vol 16 pp li-lxi signed by J F W H
References: S Ross, 'Faraday Consults the Scholars: the Origins of the Terms of Electrochemistry' in NR 1961 vol 16 pp 187-220, plate
